channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15544] HFileReaderImpl.readBlock allocates memory for HFileBlock on every call
item.description: This accounts for 25% of memory allocation during compaction when compression is enabled.
item.summary: HFileReaderImpl.readBlock allocates memory for HFileBlock on every call

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Yeah, we allocate buffers to do compression. What you suggest Vladimir Rodionov?
Reuse them if cache-on-read is disabled (including compaction case).

For a normal read, we may not be able to reuse them. The cells read from this block might not have been written out to RPC layer yet! The cells will directly refer to these byte[] to which we read from HDFS. Ya in case of compaction, we may reuse them. We have already written the cells to compacted file writer.

Experimental patch. Only for compaction threads. The optimization should work for any scanner with caching disabled, but make it easy usable for general case is not that easy (hate additional config options)
This shows some 20% reduction in memory allocation speed during compactions. Combined with HBASE-15509 it will give 40-45% reduction.

-1 overall

So this will keep buffers in pool permanently. What will be max size of all such buffers? Running it for a long time do you see improvement wrt collective GC pause time and perf?
